translated: This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in virtuous behavior …

original: tassime pañca nīvaraṇe pahīne attani samanupassato pāmojjaṁ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedeti, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.🔽So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ.🔽Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena
analyzed: tassa ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahīne attani samanupassato pāmojjam jāyati pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vedeti sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati  saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena
translated: When he sees these five hindrances abandoned within himself, joy arises. When he is joyful, rapture arises. When the mind is uplifted by rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, he feels bliss. And when he is blissful, his mind becomes concentrated.

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: He abides intent on and pervading that direction with a mind filled with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the entire world with a mind filled with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.

original: Seyyathāpi, vāseṭṭha, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api vāseṭṭha balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva catuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: Just as if a mighty trumpeter were with little difficulty to make a proclamation to the four quarters,

original: evameva kho, vāseṭṭha, evaṁ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam eva kho vāseṭṭha evam bhāvitāya mettāya cetaḥ vimuttiyāḥ yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: so, Vasettha, when the liberation of mind by loving-kindness is developed in this way, no trace of the thought of lust remains there, no trace of the thought of hatred, no trace of the thought of cruelty.

original: Ayampi kho, vāseṭṭha, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo.
analyzed: ayam pi kho vāseṭṭha brahmānam sahabya tāya maggaḥ
translated: This, Vasettha, is the path, the way to union with Brahma.

original: Puna caparaṁ, vāseṭṭha, bhikkhu karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: puna capara vāseṭṭha bhikkhu karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: “Again, Vasettha, a bhikkhu abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…🔽upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ.🔽Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā pe  upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: with a mind imbued with appreciative joy…🔽with a mind imbued with equanimity…

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: He abides pervading the entire world, upwards, downwards, across, and everywhere with a mind imbued with equanimity, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.

original: Seyyathāpi, vāseṭṭha, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api vāseṭṭha balavā saṅkha dhamaḥ appa kasirena iva catuddisā viññāpeyya
translated: Just as if a mighty trumpeter were with difficulty to make a fanfare,

original: evameva kho, vāseṭṭha, evaṁ bhāvitāya upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evam eva kho vāseṭṭha evam bhāvitāya upekkhāya cetaḥ vimuttiyāḥ yam pamāṇa katam kammam na tam tatra avasissati na tam tatra avatiṭṭhati
translated: so too, Vasettha, when the liberation of mind by equanimity has been developed in this way, whatever action he initiates with his body, speech, or mind is based on equanimity.

original: Ayampi kho, vāseṭṭha, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo.
analyzed: ayam pi kho vāseṭṭha brahmānam sahabya tāya maggaḥ
translated: This too, Vasettha, is the path, the way to union with Brahma.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, vāseṭṭha,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi vāseṭṭha
translated: What do you think, Vasettha?

original: evaṁvihārī bhikkhu sapariggaho vā apariggaho vā”ti?
analyzed: evavihārī bhikkhu sa pariggahaḥ vā apariggahaḥ vā ati
translated: Would a bhikkhu who abided thus be one who folds his legs crosswise, erects his body, and sets his mindfulness to the fore?”

original: “Apariggaho, bho gotama”.
analyzed: a pariggahaḥ bho gotama
translated: “He is not, Master Gotama.”

original: “Saveracitto vā averacitto vā”ti?
analyzed: savera cittaḥ vai avera cittaḥ vā ati
translated: “Is his mind with hate or without hate?”

original: “Averacitto, bho gotama”.
analyzed: avera cittaḥ bho gotama
translated: “Without hate, Master Gotama.”

original: “Sabyāpajjacitto vā abyāpajjacitto vā”ti?
analyzed: sa byāpajja cittaḥ vā a byāpajja cittaḥ vā ati
translated: “Is his mind with ill will or without ill will?”

original: “Abyāpajjacitto, bho gotama”.
analyzed: a byāpajja cittaḥ bho gotama
translated: “Without ill will, Master Gotama.”

original: “Saṅkiliṭṭhacitto vā asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto vā”ti?
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭha cittaḥ vā a saṅkiliṭṭha cittaḥ vā ati
translated: “Is his mind corrupted or uncorrupted?”

original: “Asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto, bho gotama”.
analyzed: a saṅkiliṭṭha cittaḥ bho gotama
translated: “Uncorrupted, Master Gotama.”

original: “Vasavattī vā avasavattī vā”ti?
analyzed: vasavattī vai a vasavattī vā ati
translated: “Is he subject to bondage or free from bondage?”

original: “Vasavattī, bho gotama”.
analyzed: vasavattī bho gotama
translated: “Free from bondage, Master Gotama.”

original: “Iti kira, vāseṭṭha, apariggaho bhikkhu, apariggaho brahmā.
analyzed: iti kira vāseṭṭha apariggahaḥ bhikkhu apariggahaḥ brahmā
translated: “So, Vasettha, a bhikkhu who is not grasping is like Brahma who is not grasping.

original: Api nu kho apariggahassa bhikkhuno apariggahena brahmunā saddhiṁ saṁsandati sametī”ti?
analyzed: api nu kho apariggahassa bhikkhunaḥ apariggahena brahmunā saddhim sasandati sameti iti
translated: Now, Vasettha, can a bhikkhu who is not grasping come into association and contact with Brahma who is not grasping?”

original: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: eva bho gotama
translated: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

original: “Sādhu, vāseṭṭha, so vata vāseṭṭha apariggaho bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apariggahassa brahmuno sahabyūpago bhavissatīti, ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: sādhu vāseṭṭha saḥ vata vāseṭṭha apariggahaḥ bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apariggahassa brahmuno sahabyūpagaḥ bhavissati iti ṭhānam etam vijjati
translated: “Good, Vasettha. It is possible that a bhikkhu who is not grasping, with the breakup of the body, after death, will reappear in the company of Brahma who is not grasping.

original: Iti kira, vāseṭṭha, averacitto bhikkhu, averacitto brahmā …pe…
analyzed: iti kira vāseṭṭha avera cittaḥ bhikkhu avera cittaḥ brahmā pe
translated: So, Vasettha, a bhikkhu who is without hate is like Brahma who is without hate…

original: abyāpajjacitto bhikkhu, abyāpajjacitto brahmā …
analyzed: a byāpajja cittaḥ bhikkhu a byāpajja cittaḥ brahmā
translated: A monk with a mind of non-ill will …

original: asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto bhikkhu, asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto brahmā …
analyzed: a saṅkiliṭṭha cittaḥ bhikkhu a saṅkiliṭṭha cittaḥ brahmā
translated: A monk with an undefiled mind …

original: vasavattī bhikkhu, vasavattī brahmā, api nu kho vasavattissa bhikkhuno vasavattinā brahmunā saddhiṁ saṁsandati sametī”ti?
analyzed: vasavattī bhikkhu vasavattī brahmā api nu kho vasavattissa bhikkhunaḥ vasavattinā brahmunā saddhim sasandati sameti iti
translated: A monk who is a powerful master … a powerful master Brahmā … Would it be proper for a monk who is a powerful master to associate and converse with a powerful master Brahmā?”

original: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: eva bho gotama
translated: “Yes, it would, Master Gotama.”🔽“It is good, Vāseṭṭha. It is fitting for a monk who is a powerful master to associate and converse with a powerful master Brahmā.

original: “Sādhu, vāseṭṭha, so vata, vāseṭṭha, vasavattī bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā vasavattissa brahmuno sahabyūpago bhavissatīti, ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu vāseṭṭha saḥ vata vāseṭṭha vasavattī bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā vasavattissa brahmuno sahabyūpagaḥ bhavissati iti ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: It is possible that a monk who is a powerful master, with the breakup of the body, after death, will be reborn in companionship with a powerful master Brahmā.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, vāseṭṭhabhāradvājā māṇavā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte vāseṭṭha bhāradvājāḥ māṇavāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the brahmin students Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Master Gotama has made the Dhamma clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who is lost, or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms.

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: In the same way, the Buddha has revealed the Dhamma in many ways.

original: Ete mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma, dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: ete mayam bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: We go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsake no bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.🔽Tevijjasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ terasamaṁ.
analyzed: upāsake naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇam gatā iti  tevijja suttam niṭṭhitam terasama
translated: Please accept us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”🔽The thirteenth sutta in the Aṭṭhaka Nipāta is finished.

original: Sīlakkhandhavaggo niṭṭhito.🔽Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: sīlakkhandha vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ  tassa uddāna
translated: The Sīlakkhandha Vagga is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Brahmāsāmaññaambaṭṭha,
analyzed: brahma a sāmañña ambaṭṭha
translated: Brahmā, the Sāmañña, Aṁbāṭṭha,

original: Soṇakūṭamahālijālinī;
translated: Soṇa, the peak, Kūṭa, the great, the net,

original: Sīhapoṭṭhapādasubho kevaṭṭo,
translated: Sīha, Poṭṭhapāda, Subha, Kevaḍḍha,

original: Lohiccatevijjā terasāti.
analyzed: lohit catevijjā terasā ati
translated: Lohicca, the three knowledges, the thirteenth.

original: Sīlakkhandhavaggapāḷi niṭṭhitā.
translated: The Sīlakkhandha Vagga is finished.
